items.title: Russian share of India's January oil imports lowest since late 2022, data shows
items.summary: India's reliance on Russian oil has decreased significantly. January saw the lowest Russian crude imports since late 2022. Middle Eastern oil now dominates India's imports, reaching its highest share. This shift comes as India navigates Western sanctions and trade agreements. Future imports from Russia are expected to further decline.

items.title: Planning for your child’s future? From NPS Vatsalya to mutual funds, here’s what you need to know
items.summary: Experts highlighted that educational inflation has consistently grown at a quicker pace than overall inflation. The cost of education increases by approximately 9 per cent each year, while general inflation stands between 2.5 per cent and 6 per cent. For example, the cost of higher education at premier institutes like IIM has grown from its 2000 value of Rs 1.5 lakh to its present value, which ranges between Rs 20 lakh and Rs 25 lakh. This demonstrates that inflation assessment needs to take priority during long-term financial planning.

items.title: Private credit: Bringing an investment approach into lending
items.summary: Private credit blends the discipline of lending with the forward-looking mindset of investing. By offering bespoke, negotiated capital structures across business lifecycles, it provides flexible, growth-oriented financing. As Indian businesses evolve, private credit is emerging as a vital, permanent component of modern capital structures rather than an alternative.

The leaders virtually inaugurated a Tata Airbus facility for helicopter manufacturing and export, underscoring a commitment to 'Make in India' and bilateral innovation.

items.title: IOB unveils online death claim settlement portal

items.title: All infant formula made locally: Nestle India
items.summary: In a reassuring move for concerned parents, Nestle India highlights that its range of infant formula brands, including Nan Pro, Lactogen, and Nan Grow, are produced locally. This statement comes in the wake of international investigations into baby milk contamination.

items.title: Premium motorcycles gain speed as consumer sentiment shifts gears
items.summary: Consumer preference is shifting towards higher-powered, premium motorcycles, with bikes 125cc and above now comprising 26% of sales in the first 10 months of FY26, up from 22.1% in FY20. This trend is fueled by improving affordability and evolving consumer aspirations, benefiting manufacturers like Royal Enfield and TVS Motor.

items.title: IOC, BPCL, HPCL double combined profit to Rs 23,743 crore in December quarter
items.summary: The gross refining margin (GRM) for Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) quadrupled in the third quarter, while that of Bharat Petroleum (BPCL) grew over two-fold, aided by softer crude and stronger product cracks.

items.title: Fixed-price ATM pacts are the new normal for banks
items.summary: Indian banks are moving to fixed-price contracts for ATM management. This change replaces older transaction-based models. Banks seek cost stability and assured service quality. This shift aims for predictable expenses and better performance from vendors. Many new ATM and cash recycler contracts are being awarded under this fixed-fee structure. This ensures consistent service and improved customer convenience.

items.title: Sitarist Rishab Rikhiram Sharma highlights music, meditation & mental health
items.summary: Rishab Rikhiram Sharma transforms classical Indian music into a tool for mental health. His concerts blend breathing exercises, meditation, and traditional Dhrupad music with Bollywood melodies. Sharma's innovative approach creates community experiences, offering a pause from an overstimulated world. He is also exploring the science behind sound's impact on the brain. Sharma's pan-India tour focuses on well-being.

items.title: Longer winter pours cold water on summer loading of consumer companies
items.summary: Summer product sales are off to a slow start. An extended winter and leftover stock from last year have delayed the usual sales cycle. Companies are now waiting for warmer weather and the Holi festival to boost demand. Manufacturers are optimistic about a rebound, expecting pent-up demand and potential price increases to drive sales.

items.title: Kotak Mahindra, DCB Bank name new directors
items.summary: Kotak Mahindra Bank has appointed Ramesh Iyer as an additional and independent director. This appointment is effective February 17, 2026. Dr. Ashok Gulati will retire as an independent director on March 5, 2026. DCB Bank has also approved Suhail Nathani's appointment as an independent director. This takes effect from February 18, 2026.

items.title: ‘Decade of the Robot’ Paves Way for Trillion-Dollar Market, Barclays Says
items.summary: The market for AI-powered robots and autonomous machines has the potential to balloon into a trillion-dollar opportunity by 2035, orders of magnitude bigger than it is now, according to a team of Barclays analysts.

items.title: Bill Gates’ Breakthrough Energy Catalyst Halts New Investment, Lays Off Staff
items.summary: Its focus is now shifting to startups it’s already funded, which requires a smaller team, a spokesperson said.

items.title: Muthoot Microfin looks to buy company offering loan against property
items.summary: Muthoot Microfin is exploring inorganic growth by acquiring a majority stake in two non-banking financial companies. This move aims to expand its micro loan against property business. The company is diversifying its portfolio following recent RBI policy changes. Muthoot Microfin plans to significantly increase its secured lending. This strategy will reduce reliance on unsecured microfinance loans.

items.title: Distributors turn to connected TV as pay TV users shrink to 84 million
items.summary: As traditional cable and DTH subscriptions decline, Indian TV distributors are innovatively migrating linear channels to Connected TV. This shift is not only about tapping into the rise of smart TVs in homes but also about keeping subscribers engaged.

items.title: India looks to Middle East, Asia to cushion EU carbon tax blow to steel exports
items.summary: India is actively exploring new export destinations for its steel in the Middle East and Asia. This strategic shift aims to mitigate the effects of the European Union's carbon tax. The nation is also focusing on securing essential raw materials through long-term agreements and asset acquisitions.

items.title: CTUIL-Grid India merger back on Centre's agenda to revamp transmission sector
items.summary: The government is planning to separate CTUIL from Power Grid Corporation and merge it with Grid India. This move aims to eliminate conflicts of interest in awarding transmission projects and foster a more structured approach to capacity expansion. Grid India may then be designated as the central transmission utility, ensuring a level playing field for all bidders.

items.title: States urged to expedite capex proposals, use up funds before March 31
items.summary: The government is pushing states to quickly approve and implement projects under the Special Assistance to States for Capital Expenditure scheme.  Over ₹1.04 lakh crore has already been released.  With the March 31 deadline approaching, the focus is on timely utilization of the remaining funds.  This initiative supports infrastructure spending by states.

They explored boosting collaboration in solar power, rare earth processing, and carbon capture. Both leaders agreed to utilize the Trade and Economic Partnership Agreement for growth in blue and green economies.

items.title: Warehouses beat offices to become hottest realty bet
items.summary: Institutional investors are pouring capital into India's warehousing and logistics sector. This real estate segment now attracts more investment than offices and retail. Investors seek stable, long-term returns from large platforms. These platforms are being prepared for public market listings. The sector is growing rapidly due to e-commerce and manufacturing expansion. This makes it a strong choice for institutional capital.

items.title: Bernstein says India could benefit if US recession hits
items.summary: Investing.com -- Bernstein believes India could emerge as a winner if the US economy enters a recession, given country’s unique economic resilience and strong domestic drivers. “The largest and the fifth-largest economies have in the past often been fairly independent of each other without strong linkages,” analyst at Bernstein said. items.title: Bernstein stays cautious on India exposure, prefers low volatility, large-caps
items.summary: Investing.com -- Bernstein maintained a cautious stance on India exposure despite early signs of market inflection, advising against chasing small/mid-caps and high-volatility stocks. The firm reiterated its preference for large-cap and low-volatility stocks, which it views as the “cheapest” styles relative to the market and beneficiaries of strong earnings tailwinds.

items.title: Indian mutual funds need to focus on investor expectations, not just returns
items.summary: Investing.com -- Indian mutual funds should focus more on managing investor expectations rather than just chasing returns. Fund houses often overlook how retail investors react to market ups and downs, which affects long-term performance.
